newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Malayan Credit sees lower 1997 results.
newsitem.headline: Malayan Credit sees lower 1997 results.

text.p: Property development company Malayan Credit Ltd said on Wednesday it expected its financial results for 1997 to be somewhat lower than those of 1996.

Malayan Credit said in a statement with its 1996 annual results the Singapore property market had slowed down significantly since the introduction of government measures in May 1996 to reduce speculation in the market.
"A difficult business environment is expected to continue," the statement said.

"Earnings from the group's investment properties are expected to remain stable during the year. Based on the present rate of progress of development projects, the board expects the results for the current year to be somewhat lower than those of 1996."
